text: Ever wonder how Twitter handles... FIVE HUNDRED MILLION tweets... every single day? Let's break it down.
Here's the thing. Millions of users, all wanting their timeline in under 200 milliseconds. That's faster than you can blink!
So how do they do it? Simple. Your request hits a CDN, then load balancers, then microservices, all backed by Redis and MySQL.
When you tweet... it gets stored in the database. But here's the magic â€” it's PUSHED to all your followers' timelines instantly.
And when YOU open your feed? Twitter just grabs it from Redis. No database hit. Boom! Instant timeline.
But wait... what about celebrities? Elon Musk has a hundred million followers. Fanning out to ALL of them? That would crash the system!
That's where sharding comes in. User data is split across multiple databases using a simple hash. No single server gets overwhelmed.
So remember: Fan-out on write... Redis caching... hybrid for celebrities... and sharded databases. THAT'S how Twitter scales!
